page.title: 03FORESTRY
page.content: Each year 10,000 Christmas trees are specially grown to sell to the public. They grow Norwegian and Corsican Pine. The area round Loch Glow was last planted in 1982.The Forestry Commission always consults the Fife Water Board incase water catchment levels are affected but so far this has not been a problem. The Water Board request that when the Forestry Commission wish to fertilise the land they do it by spraying from helicopters 50m from the edge of the Loch,in order that none is sprayed on the Loch and may posion the fish.The Forestry Commission have no plans for accquiring more land in the area.
